phrase.item: Oh God I ask you not to make me a stranger [in a foreign land], don't let me be sick for long and without a doctor.
Being sick for a long time without a doctor is up to God, [so I ask] please don't separate me from my dear youth.
My dear mother I miss seeing you, from not seeing your face, I became sick.
I wasn't grateful to you then, [but] in the end I faced my hardships.
We are partridges and our nest is a mountain, I am sick and my dear mother is unaware of it.
Oh dear mother, you should tear your greiving [lit. unhappy] dress, put it under your pillow at night and in the day don't wail.
Don't put pure salt on a clean new cut, it kills me, and don't spread rumors.
When it kills me, sew me a kafan [cloth] with your hand, never let me be in a stranger's hand again.
Oh dear mother, don't be unfaithful, don't make the mistake of believing the things [your] enemies say.
If the enemies give you their wealth, reject their wealth [and] don't be separate from me.
